channel.title: windows on Random thoughts of a Developer
channel.description: Recent content in windows on Random thoughts of a Developer

item.title: Hyper-V Blocked Port
item.description: Issue: We noticed an issue following Windows 10 update 1809 where Windows would reserve a range of ports that included port 50,000. Sometimes even 1303 (node) or 2181 (zookeeper) or IntellijIDE default ports. When you check which process is using the current port using the command netstat -an We find that the port is not being used. These ports are being reserved by docker or Hyper-V. To find ports reserved by docker/Hyper-V netsh interface ipv4 show excludedportrange protocol=tcp
